title: Michelin Guide skips Australian restaurants and heads to New Zealand | ABC NEWS
description: The prestigious Michelin Guide is bypassing Australia and is heading to New Zealand to put Oceania on the global culinary map. It comes after Tourism Australia passed on the opportunity citing the high cost that’s involved with being associated with the Michelin brand. Wes Lambert from the Australian Restaurant and Cafe Association discusses the effects of Michelin, saying the famous guide brings a “massive uplift” in destination dining. title: Inside Vienna’s social housing model as home ownership declines for younger Australians | ABC NEWS
description: As home ownership declines for younger Australians, Vienna’s social housing model could provide a solution to end the rental crisis. It’s estimated about a third of Australians live in rented accommodation and it’s expected to keep growing. title: Record number of bear attacks in Japan | Asia News Week | ABC NEWS
description: Japan has deployed troops to the country's mountainous north to help trap bears as authorities struggle with a wave of attacks. There have been more than 100 bear attacks in the country since April, with at least 13 people killed. North Asia correspondent James Oaten tells Asia News Week's Yvonne Yong what is behind the increase in numbers and what residents are doing to address the issue. title: Former Labor minister Graham Richardson dead at 76 | ABC NEWS
description: Labor powerbroker Graham Richardson has died aged 76. The former politician died after weeks of influenza and pneumonia, 2GB Breakfast host Ben Fordham announced after speaking to his wife and son. Graham Richardson has lived for years after being diagnosed with a rare form of bone cancer. title: Car driven into tobacco store and set alight in Melbourne’s southeast | ABC NEWS
description: A car has been driven into a tobacco store and set alight in Mentone, in Melbourne's southeast. The fire engulfed the two-storey building and threatened to spread to neighbouring apartments, forcing residents to flee to safety. title: US food support and flights cancelled amid government shutdown | ABC NEWS
description: The White House is seeking to block a court order that mandates full food stamp benefits for 42 million low-income Americans in November.  The shutdown is affecting domestic air travel, with airlines cancelling flights due to a shortage of unpaid air traffic controllers. title: Asian fast fashion giant Shein opens Paris store amid protests | Asia News Week | ABC NEWS
description: Shein is under fire in France after the country's consumer watch dog found the Asian e-commerce site selling childlike sex dolls. This week, Shein opened its first permanent physical store in Paris, which was met with protests over the sex doll scandal, but also in relation to Shein's poor environmental credentials and questionable labour practices. Fashion journalist and podcaster Maggie Zhou unpacks why Shein has always been controversial, in conversation with Asia News Week's Yvonne Yong. title: What might Shein's first permanent store in Paris mean for Australia? | ABC NEWS
description: Fast-fashion retailer, Shein, launched its first permanent store in the world inside one of Paris's most iconic department stores. The store drew crowds of shoppers and a small group of demonstrators waving anti-Shein signs who briefly disrupted the opening ceremony before they were escorted out by security. Fashion journalist, Maggie Zhou, weighs in on what this could mean for Australia.  By Madeline Lo-Booth and Angelica Silva, ABC Asia Pacific Newsroom. title: Single parents struggle to re-enter housing market after divorce | ABC NEWS
description: Rising housing costs make it difficult for couples going through divorce to achieve independent homeownership. Women especially face challenges securing mortgages due to lower incomes from caregiving.  An upcoming shared equity scheme could help divorcees buy a home. title: INTRODUCING: The Case of Toyah's Murder
description: In 2018, 24-year-old Toyah Cordingly went for a walk with her dog on one of north Queensland's idyllic beaches. The next morning, her body was found buried in the sand.   Next week, her accused killer will stand trial before a jury in Cairns. The defendant, Rajwinder Singh, denies the charges.   The Case of Toyah's Murder will be your eyes and ears inside the Cairns Supreme Court as the trial of Rajwinder Singh unfolds.   In this season of The Case Of, Stephen Stockwell will be joined by ABC Far North Queensland Reporter Christopher Testa to bring you all the details the jury hears.   If you have any questions about this trial you'd like Chris and Stocky to answer in future episodes, please email thecaseof@abc.net.au (mailto:thecaseof@abc.net.au) .   The Case Of is the follow-up to the hit podcast Mushroom Case Daily, and all episodes of that show will remain available in the back catalogue of The Case Of.

title: US passengers scramble amid widespread flight cancellations | ABC NEWS
description: Hundreds of US flights have been cancelled due to a government shutdown, as Democrats and Republicans remain at an impasse.  The FAA has imposed cutbacks since some air traffic controllers are not being paid, affecting 40 airports, including major hubs in Atlanta, Newark, Denver, Chicago, Houston, and Los Angeles. title: Tragedy in a rural town after freight train hits a baby | ABC NEWS
description: A small remote community on the NSW north west slopes is reeling after a one-year-old girl was killed after being struck by a freight train. title: Typhoon Kalmaegi ravages Vietnam, Philippines prepares for new storm | ABC NEWS
description: Typhoon Kalmaegi has hit Vietnam, causing strong winds and heavy rain that led to at least five deaths and extensive damage.  Earlier, the storm had claimed 204 lives in the Philippines, where survivors are mourning as another typhoon approaches. title: Tributes for former Labor heavyweight Graham Richardson, who died aged 76 | ABC NEWS
description: Labor powerbroker and former minister, Graham Richardson, is being remembered as a 'legend of the party' following his death at the age of 76. 'Richo', as he was known, spent decades in and around politics, helping to topple leaders and courting controversy, before becoming an outspoken television commentator. He died after many years of ill-health. title: Tech fanatics gather for video games, virtual reality and digital art in Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: Darwin's digital future has been on display, with tech fanatics gathering for a festival of video games, virtual reality and digital art.
